intro: Silene loiseleurii, commonly known as the Loiseleur's campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and showy pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Silene loiseleurii is often found at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowering period usually occurs in late summer, adding a splash of color to the alpine landscape.
